item.title: Walking queue error D:
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:4, topic:442576”]Not going to deal with RSPS, its Java error obviously.

http://compsci.ca/v3/viewtopic.php?t=5735:

That means that the array isn’t long enough for the index you’re trying to access.

in Java (as in many other programing languages) zero is the first index of an array. If the array is empty, though, then attempting to access the zero-th element will result in an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

He explains it pretty nicely.

Post line 1329 of the Player class.[/quote]
Well it stopped the errors, but Now it’s not clipped. <_<

if(inCw()) { try { int tempabsX = absX+Misc.directionDeltaX[dir]; int tempabsY = absY+Misc.directionDeltaY[dir]; if(checkBarricade(tempabsX,tempabsY,heightLevel)){ return -1; } }catch(ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException e){ } }

Read full topic

in Java (as in many other programing languages) zero is the first index of an array. If the array is empty, though, then attempting to access the zero-th element will result in an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

what im doing: Clipping barricades.
What the error keeps me from doing: after laying it down I try to walk and it responds really slow until I relog, I tried making it reset walking queue… ;-;

line error

[code]if(inCw()) {
int tempabsX = absX+Misc.directionDeltaX[dir];
int tempabsY = absY+Misc.directionDeltaY[dir];
resetWalkingQueue();
